Long answer is use the damn search man. I get it that you just getting into this, but seriously so is many other people. This question has been talked about to death for months.
I could see that.
But aside from the valiant episode, I don't remember any other cadets in DS9 during that period. Not arguing the real world validity, but the in universe rationale.

Haven't played that fat yet, at I'm on console, but with the amount of killing the PC does I'm sure we committed genocide on their asses.

If I remember correctly it was Nog's sophomore year so he isn't even fully trained. It wasn't like Kelvin Kirk/ or Red squad who were on the verge of graduating. I do understand that with the server lack of manpower. That they needed everyone.
You get your last rank promotion ship at 40, so decide what t5 ship you want and compare.

That's why they use stardates. What the year on earth is vs where ds9 is is relative.

Took me a while to think about this, but what if you treat the whole STO experience as a holosuite/deck program. Each time you log out the program is saved. It is resumed when you sign in. I figure using covariant shield would help due to the large amount of points they offer.

WRITING.TITLE: Any tips for new players to the game (on console) about flying ships?
WRITING.TEXT:
Just started playing when it came out for console. I was wondering if anyone had advice and tips on how to best utilize each ship in regards to flying habits. I get the basic of the three types of ships and have read that it is possible to spec any ship to work for any role to an extent.
Was more looking for in game tips on how to fly the ships. I like using cruisers as a tac officer. But due to current gear restrictions the turn rate is almost too much a hindrance. Apologies if this is a silly question. I tried googling this but most threads go into more about how to maximize gear, not so much in game flight strategies.
But there is a EC cost to modify your characters outfit
Do you have the necessary resource to pay for those changes?
